description: Fruits are nature's sweet and edible parts of plants that contain seeds. They are rich in vitamins, fiber, and antioxidants.
Vegetables are edible parts of plants, such as leaves, stems, roots, and flowers. They are essential for a balanced diet and provide vital nutrients.
Dairy products are foods made from milk, such as cheese, yogurt, and butter. They are a good source of calcium and protein.
Meat includes animal flesh consumed as food, including beef, pork, lamb, and poultry. It is a rich source of protein and essential nutrients.
Seafood includes fish, shellfish, and other sea creatures consumed as food. It is known for its high-quality protein and omega-3 fatty acids.
Grains are small, hard, and edible seeds from cereal crops, such as wheat, rice, oats, and quinoa. They are a staple food in many diets.
Legumes are plants with seeds that grow in pods, such as beans, lentils, and chickpeas. They are an excellent source of plant-based protein.
Nuts and seeds are small, edible, and nutrient-dense foods. They are rich in healthy fats, protein, vitamins, and minerals.
Beverages include liquids that are consumed for hydration, refreshment, and nutrition, such as water, juice, tea, and coffee.
Snacks are small portions of food eaten between meals, often for quick energy or pleasure. They include items like chips, nuts, and granola bars.
